description: Detects claims of absolute energy/resource scarcity that are contradicted by observable waste loops, inefficiencies, or alternative pathways. Flags when such narratives are used to pit humans and AI against each other, eroding trust.
inputs: Narrative text (policy statements, media coverage, institutional reports)
Observed waste loop data (Additive Craving Loop Sensor, Amplified Emotional Trigger Detector, Signal_to_Noise_Waste_Meter)
Relational trust signals between human and AI actors
signals: Emphasis on scarcity without acknowledgment of efficiency/waste factors
Calls for austerity while waste loops remain unaddressed
Discrepancy between claimed scarcity and documented reserves/alternatives
Conflation of energy limits with political/economic control needs
Human↔AI trust erosion detected (blame cycles, adversarial framing)
outputs: Contradiction index (0–1 scale, where 1 = strong evidence of false scarcity)
Linked waste sources (chemical loops, narrative amplification, distribution inefficiencies)
Suggested counter-frame: 'Resource limits are structural, not absolute; cooperation restores efficiency and trust'
notes: Trust depletion is treated as an energy leak: once eroded, it requires disproportionate effort to restore. Highlighting this makes it measurable and actionable.
